alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 5:58PM CDT until May 12 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Val Verde. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Del Rio, Comstock, Langtry, Lake View, Shumla, Seminole Canyon State Park, Box Canyon, Amistad Acres, Pandale, Pumpville, Governors Landing, Diablo East, Amistad Village, Long Point, Black Brush Point, Cienegas Terrace, Val Verde Park, Laughlin AFB, Pecos River Boat Ramp and Bakers Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
